title: Who is Lottie Lion from The Apprentice 2019?
text:
Lord Sugar has compared librarian Lottie Lion to a fine wine following the first episode of The Apprentice (Picture: BBC/PA)

Lottie Lion entered The Apprentice as the BBC hit’s youngest ever contestant, promising to build an empire and give extremely short shrift to those she perceives as fools or timewasters.

So it’s perhaps not surprise to see the 19-year-old from Somerset earning many of the headlines in the first week of the new series while contributing to the brand of divisive drama beloved of fans of The Apprentice.

It’s early days in the race for the £250,000 prize, but how much do we know about Lottie Lion? Here’s a look at what we’ve learned so far…

Who is Lottie Lion and how did she get to be on The Apprentice 2019?

Born to a Belgian family in North Devon, Lottie moved to a farm outside Dulverton where she showed her entrepreneurial verve by setting up a car-cleaning business as a 12-year-old before studying at Richard Huish College.

Having moved to Taunton, where the college is based, she worked as a librarian at Bishop Fox’s School, also setting up a national members’ club for ladies in the countryside.

‘We are a socially elite members’ club,’ she has explained. ‘I brand it as that but it’s more a luxury, an experience.

‘We’re open to the majority of females unless they are awful company, in which case we don’t really want that. I’m friendly, I’m chatty, I like to think that I’m approachable, but I don’t see any point in carrying dead weight on my journey to the top.’

Lottie’s application to The Apprentice was fuelled by drinking wine while watching TV, and she is said to have forgotten about her interest in the show until she was chosen as one of 600 applicants to take part in auditions.

Once the shortlist had been narrowed down to 70 potential contestants, she passed a day of screen tests and a psychological assessment.

She felt she should have led the task and had some noticeably testy moments with the other women on her team, but was praised by Lord Sugar for her role in the challenge.

Does Lottie from The Apprentice know Lord Sugar?

As well as denying accusations of racism after comments from the cast’s WhatsApp group leaked online, Lottie has been linked to Apprentice top dog Lord Sugar amid suggestions that her father’s company can access the billionaire for speaking engagements.

Dominique Lion runs Leaders for Business, but a spokesman for Lord Sugar insisted to The Mirror: ‘He doesn’t know him. He has never heard of him. There’s no connection between them.’

Lottie frequently posts photos of herself living the high life on social media (Picture: Instagram / lottie.lion)

Lord Sugar, meanwhile, has made no personal mention of the claims, instead offering a typically curt observation on Lottie’s early impact as a candidate.

He tweeted: ‘Lottie is like a fine wine bouquet. It seems she gets up everyone’s nose.’

Lottie previously told the County Gazette: ‘My nickname on social media is Marmite – people either love me or hate me.

‘People think I’m this character on the TV so it doesn’t actually affect me. It does, but I’m a strong person and I’ve dealt with hate before.’

When is The Apprentice on next?

Fans can watch Lottie and the remaining contestants take part in a task based around ice lollies on BBC One at 9pm tonight.

The Apprentice: You’re Fired follows on BBC Two from 10pm.

The Apprentice is next on BBC One at 9pm tonight.
